instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message:
Hi, I have a liquid damaged 820-0138 with hi fans. The damage is minor and directly was found on R5381. G3_Poweron_L pad was burnt off the board as well. i have so far ran a wire from G3_Poweron_L to its test point next to R5172. SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is fluctuating from 3.42 - 3.20V. Replaced R5381 and reballed the original SMC and ISL. Diode mode on SMBUS is .510 and Diode on G3_Poweron_L is .728. Fans are still high with no other signs of liquid. Should I try another SMC? Any advice would be appreciated.

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message:
Try known good trackpad and flex first.
SCL/SDA linees of battery bus should measure less than 1% difference to ground, on diode mode.
If battery is recognized and charging, that bus is OK.

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message: Will do, and thanks for the explanation.

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message:
Just got new trackpad and flex in. No difference. Fans still high and system runs poorly. 

Thanks.

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message: Do you have an oscilloscope to check if there is some activity on SDA and SCL lines????

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message: Install some software which shows the temps from the board...

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply's, I appreciate it.

Temps are all way off. ---------------->>>  [url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/jwrRGBnpyA24CdqC7[/url]

Thanks again.

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message:
Thanks.

Q5410

Pin 1 - 0
Pin 2 - 3.323V
Pin 3 -17.04V
Pin 4 -17.06V
Pin 5 - 0.003V
Pin 6 -0.003V

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message:
Pin 5 should be aprox 8.5V; hoewever, pin 3 is correct.
Post SMC_DCIN_VSENSE value.
Check for corrosion on that trace...

threads.title: 820-00138 High Fans
threads.message: Customer suddenly decided not to repair this one after all. Thanks again.
